laboratory_examinations.findings: Before intervention: Serum Calcium: Not specified, PTH: Range 235–864 ng/liter. Postoperative (93-month follow-up): PTH levels ranged between 56 and 182 ng/liter (normal: <187 ng/liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum Calcium and PTH levels both increased over time before the intervention. Postoperatively, PTH levels decreased significantly from elevated levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Ionized calcium rose from 1.29 to 1.39 mmol/liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive rise in ionized calcium observed over the specified time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal serum phosphorus at preoperative assessment: 3.5 mg/dl (1.1 mmol/liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Normalized serum phosphorus was maintained during the follow-up.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Before intervention: Alkaline phosphatase: 72 U/liter (normal: 36–115 U/liter).
Normal bone density at the spine, hip, and radius.
Mild hypercalcemia and rising PTH levels (94 to 235 ng/liter) with normal phosphorus.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increasing PTH levels noted over the years.
Indicates changes with surgery and subsequent treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Intraoperative PTH fell from 236 to 156 ng/liter after gland removal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicates that removal of the enlarged glands resulted in a significant drop.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Intraoperative PTH fell from 362 to 52 ng/liter after resection.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Drop in PTH levels indicates a successful intervention.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Eucalcemic with elevated PTH, lower than pre-surgical levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significante reduction in PTH noted post-surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased serum calcium and PTH despite treatment changes, phosphorus normal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual increase in serum calcium and PTH.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Before cinacalcet: 372 ng/liter; after cinacalcet: 280 ng/liter (P<0.01).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant decrease in PTH levels noted after initiating cinacalcet.
